title: Both, Either And Neither Grammar Exercise

exercises.title: Both, Either And Neither Grammar Exercise

questions.question: She has eaten ....................... of the chops.
questions.description: We use both to refer to two people or things.

questions.question: ............................. of us were ill so we didn't go to work.
questions.description: Both means this and that. Either means this or that. Neither means not this and not that.

questions.question: I don't like ......................... of my Grammar teachers.
questions.description: Instead of not....both, we use either.

questions.question: Rahul and Ravi .......................... went to the party.
........................... of us went to the party.
questions.description: Both expressions are possible here with totally different meanings. Both means this and that. Neither means not this and not that.

questions.question: I couldn't choose between them. I liked them ........................
You can take ........................... the apple or the orange. You can't have them ......................
questions.description: Either is used before the first of two alternatives.

questions.question: I don't think highly of .............................. of them.
questions.description: Instead of not...both, we use either.

questions.question: .................................... swim.
questions.description: We do not normally use both...not. Instead we use neither.

questions.question: I don't want ......................................
questions.description: Neither is a negative word. We can't use it with not.
